snippet: Pro-Russian demonstrators occupying a government building in Donetsk also demanded a referendum on seceding from Ukraine, hours after a Ukrainian officer was killed in Crimea.
abstract: Several hundred pro-Russian demonstrators in Donetsk, Ukraine, declare they are forming independent republic and urge Pres Vladimir V Putin to send troops to eastern region as peacekeeping force; while widely regarded as political theater supported by Kremlin, protests could help promote Russia's primary goal of destabilizing shaky Ukrainian government.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ANDREW ROTH
byline.contributor: Noah Sneider contributed reporting from Moscow, Alison Smale from Berlin, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Pro-Russian demonstrators occupying a government building in Donetsk also demanded a referendum on seceding from Ukraine, hours after a Ukrainian officer was killed in Crimea.

headline.main: In East Ukraine, Protesters Seek Russian Troops
headline.print_headline: In East Ukraine, Protesters Seek Russian Troops
